Layer.Name: cadw_designated_wrecks
Layer.Title: cadw_designated_wrecks
Layer.Abstract:
CADW has an important role to play in protecting our maritime heritage. We can legally protect important sites through designating them as scheduled ancient monuments and we can also give legal protection to the most significant wrecks by designating them under the 1973 Protection of Wrecks Act. We also work with the Marine Consents Unit to ensure that the protection of maritime heritage is taken into account during developments.
http://cadw.wales.gov.uk/historicenvironment/protection/maritimewrecks/wrecksnwreck/;jsessionid=JVBGTV5M7xgbGwjBKXTGhhLnrXHlSqVmKr9LhpYsJLrpGqnbTJlP!1587771443?lang=en

Layer.Name: Convergence_AssistedAreas_Tier1
Layer.Title: Convergence_AssistedAreas_Tier1
Layer.Abstract:
Assisted Areas are geographical locations where the government can offer additional financial support, typically to businesses, under European Commission state aid rules.
Maximum aid levels have reduced by 5% in the West Wales and the Valleys region (the category 'a' area on the map. This is also known as a 'Tier 1' area

Layer.Name: Convergence_AssistedAreas_Tier2
Layer.Title: Convergence_AssistedAreas_Tier2
Layer.Abstract: Assisted Areas are geographical locations where the government can offer additional financial support, typically to businesses, under European Commission state aid rules. For the East Wales region these are also known as 'Tier 2' areas, aid to large enterprises (those with over 250 employees) is more limited

Layer.Name: Public_Service_Footprint_Areas
Layer.Title: Public_Service_Footprint_Areas
Layer.Abstract:
The Collaborative Footprint for Public Services in Wales was agreed by Cabinet in July 2011 and presented to the Partnership Council for Wales in the same month. Building on the areas relating to Local Health Boards and Police Authorities, the footprint provides:
a framework within which public services can develop consistent approaches to new collaborative working arrangements; clarity on how public services should collaborate; and greater stability and reduced complexity.

Layer.Name: Regeneration_Areas
Layer.Title: Regeneration_Areas
Layer.Abstract:
Seven regeneration areas were established before our new regeneration framework Vibrant and Viable Places came into operation.
They were:
Heads of the Valleys Programme MÃƒÂ´n a Menai North Wales Coast Western Valleys Swansea Aberystwyth Barry The regeneration area programmes are now drawing to a close. Future targeted regeneration investment will be through the Vibrant and Viable Places framework.
